metadata.dc:author: Tamayo-Espinosa, Tania
Erdmenger-Orellana, Julio
Segura-Standford, Begoña
Becerra-Becerra, Rosario
Balderrabano-Saucedo, Norma
metadata.dc:description: The right-side aortic arch may be associated with aberrant left subclavian artery, in some cases this artery originates from an aneurismal dilation of the aorta called Kommerell's diverticulum. A report is presented on 2 cases of vascular ring formed by a right-side aortic arch, anomalous left subclavian artery, Kommerell's diverticulum and left patent ductus arteriosus. A review the literature was also performed as regards the embryological development and the imaging methods used to help in the diagnosis of this rare vascular anomaly.

metadata.dc:title: Arco aórtico derecho con subclavia izquierda aberrante y divertículo de Kommerell. Una causa de anillo vascular.
[Right-side aortic arch with aberrant left subclavian artery and Kommerell's diverticulum. A cause of vascular ring].
